sen.j: 松尾寺駅（まつのおでらえき）は、京都府舞鶴市字吉坂無番地にある西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）小浜線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Matsunoodera Station (Matsunoodera-eki) is a railway station on the Obama Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and is located in Aza-Kissaka-mubanchi, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 松尾寺駅（まつのおでらえき）→Matsuodera Station (Matsuodera-eki)としました。、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）→West Japan Railway Company (JR West) [http://www.westjr.co.jp]
sen.e: Matsunoodera Station (Matsunoodera-eki) is a railway facility on the Obama Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and is located in Aza-Kissaka-mubanchi, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Matsunoodera Station is a railway facility on the Obama Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and is located in Aza-Kissaka-mubanchi, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の表記を削除しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置1面1線のみをもつ地上駅。
sen.e: It is a ground station equipped with only a one-side and one-tracked platform.
It is a ground station having only a one-side, one-track platform.
It is a ground station having only a one-side, one-track platform.

sen.j: 1922年開業当時のままの駅舎があるが、無人駅となっている。
sen.e: Since the inauguration in 1922, the station building has been located in the present site, however it is now an unmanned station.
The station building has been located in the present site since its inauguration in 1922, but it's now an unmanned facility.
The station building has been located in the present site since its inauguration in 1922, but it's now an unmanned facility.

sen.j: 急行列車「はしだて (列車)」が走っていた頃には上下列車の列車交換が行われていたが、1999年10月2日の1987年～2000年のJRダイヤ改正1999年（平成11年）で駅での上下列車の交換が無くなり閉塞 (鉄道)分割の機能のみになった。
sen.e: While Express Hashidate (train) was running, the up and down trains crossed each other at this station, however when the JR timetable for the period 1987-2000 was revised on October 2, 1999, the station discontinued to be the passing point of the up and down train and remained only with tithe function of (railway) block and junction.
sen.cmt: 急行列車「はしだて (列車)」→Express Hashidate (train)、上下列車の列車交換→定訳不明 [単線の場合特定の駅ですれ違うことのようですので、the up and down trains crossed each otherとしました。]無人駅→unmanned station [プログレッシブ和英]
sen.e: While the "Hashidate" express (train) was running, the up and down trains crossed each other at this station; however, when the JR timetable for the period 1987-2000 was revised on October 2, 1999, the station ceased to be the passing point of the up and down trains and remained only with the function of a (railway) block and junction.

While the Express 'Hashidate (train)' was running, the inbound and outbound trains crossed each other at this station; however, when the JR timetable for the period 1987-2000 was revised on October 2, 1999, the station ceased to be the passing point of the inbound and outbound trains and remained only with the function of a (railway) block and junction.
sen.cmt: 上り、下り→inbound, outbound としました。

sen.j: その後小浜線電化工事の際に鉄道信号機や分岐器を撤去し棒線駅になった。
sen.e: After that, following the electrification of the Obama Line, the station became a straight "through" tracked station after its railway signals and turnouts were removed.
sen.cmt: 信号機→railway signals[鉄道技術用語辞典 online: http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]、 分岐器→turnout [鉄道技術用語辞典 online: http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]、棒線駅→定訳不明 [信号機、分岐器のないレールだけの駅という意味だそうですので、straight "through" tracked stationとしました]
sen.e: Subsequently, with the electrification of the Obama Line, the station became a straight "through-track" station after its railway signals and turnouts were removed.
Subsequently, with the electrification of the Obama Line, the station became a straight "through-track" station after its railway signals and turnouts were removed.

sen.j: 同時にホームのかさ上げも行われた。
sen.e: At the same time the ground level of the station was elevated.
Concurrently, the ground level of the station was elevated.
Concurrently, the platform was elevated.
sen.cmt: 駅→ホーム としました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Usage situation
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約33人である。
sen.e: The passengers a day was about 33 persons in FY 2006
sen.cmt: 英文は過去形にしました。
sen.e: The average daily number of passengers was 33 persons in fiscal year 2006.
The average daily number of passengers was about 33 in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: （Source: "Kyoto-fu Tokei-sho" (statistics of Kyoto Prefecture）
sen.cmt: 京都府統計書→定訳不明["Kyoto-fu Tokei-sho" (statistics of Kyoto Prefecture）としました]
sen.e: （Source: "Kyoto-fu Tokei-sho" (Statistics of Kyoto Prefecture）
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第29番札所の松尾寺 (舞鶴市)にちなんだ駅名であるが、寺が山の中腹にあるため約徒歩40分ほどかかるため、参拝客のほとんどは、車か、またはJR東舞鶴駅から路線バス・タクシーで寺へ向かう。
sen.e: The name derived from Matsunoodera Temple (Maizuru City), which is the 29th Fudasho (temple) of the Saigoku 33 official temple of the pilgrimage, however, since it takes about 40 minutes on foot to the temple, which is located in the middle of the mountain, most of the visitors go to the temple by car, or take a route bus or a taxi from JR Maizuru Station.
sen.cmt: 西国三十三箇所第29番札所→定訳不明 ：the 29th Fudasho (temple) of the Saigoku 33 official temple of the pilgrimageとしました。国立情報学研究所HP[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004042191] 参照。
sen.e: The name derived from Matsunoodera Temple (Maizuru City), which is the twenty-ninth fudasho (temple) of the Saigoku 33 official temples of the pilgrimage; however, since the walk to the temple takes about 40 minutes, being located in the middle of the mountain, most visitors reach the temple by car, or they may take a route bus or a taxi from JR Maizuru Station.

The name derived from Matsunoo-dera Temple (Maizuru City), which is the 29th of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage; however, since the walk to the temple takes about 40 minutes, being located in the middle of the mountain, most visitors reach the temple by car, or they may take a route bus or a taxi from JR Maizuru Station.
sen.cmt: Matsunoo-dera Temple としました。「西国三十三箇所第29番札所」の表記を変更統一

sen.j: このため、当駅からの参拝客は少なめである。
sen.e: For this reason, there are relatively few visitors who use this station.
Consequently, relatively few temple visitors use this station.
Consequently, relatively few temple visitors use this station.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 松尾寺 (舞鶴市)（西国三十三箇所第29番札所）へは東北へ約3km。
sen.e: Matsuodera Temple (Maizuru City) (the 29th pilgrimage point out of the Saikoku 33 temples): 3km to the northwest.
sen.cmt: （西国三十三箇所第29番札所）→ 定訳不明 [(the 29th pilgrimage point out of the Saikoku 33 temples)としました]
sen.e: Matsuodera Temple (Maizuru City) (the twenty-ninth pilgrimage point out of the Saikoku 33 temples): Three kilometers northwest
Matsunoo-dera Temple (Maizuru City) (No. 29 pilgrim stamp office of the 33 Temples of Saigoku): Three kilometers northeast
sen.cmt: Matsunoo-dera としました。northeast に修正しました。「西国三十三箇所第29番札所」の表記を変更統一"the 29th of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage" -> "No. 29 pilgrim stamp office of the 33 Temples of Saigoku" に変更しました。

sen.e: Kongoin Temple: 1.5km to the southwest.
Kongoin Temple: Located 1.5km southwest
Kongo-in Temple: Located 1.5 km southwest

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1922年（大正11年）12月20日 - 日本国有鉄道小浜線若狭高浜駅～東舞鶴駅間開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: December 20, 1922: it concurrently opened when the Japan National Railways Obama Line began operating between Wakasa-Takahama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.
December 20, 1922: Its opening was concurrent with the launch of operations on the Japan National Railways Obama Line between Wakasa-Takahama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.
December 20, 1922: Its opening was concurrent with the launch of operations on the Japan National Railways Obama Line between Wakasa-Takahama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.

sen.j: 一般駅。
sen.e: General station
sen.cmt: [鉄道技術用語辞典 online: http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]
sen.e: General station
General station

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）11月 - 無人駅となる。
sen.e: November 1986: it became a unmanned station.
November 1986: It became a unmanned station.
November 1986: It became an unmanned station.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 日本国有鉄道により西日本旅客鉄道・日本貨物鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Japan National Railways decided to designate it to be a station of West Japan Railway Company and Japan Freight Railway Company.
sen.cmt: 「日本国有鉄道により」←意味はこれでよいでしょうか？ご確認ください。日本貨物鉄道→Japan Freight Railway Company [http://www.jrfreigjt.co.jp]
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Japan National Railways designated it as a station of the West Japan Railway and Japan Freight Railway companies.
April 1, 1987: Japan National Railways designated it as a station of the West Japan Railway and Japan Freight Railway companies.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）3月22日 - 貨物列車の設定が廃止される。
sen.e: March 22, 1997: The designation as a freight station was revoked.
March 22, 1997: The designation as a freight station was revoked.
March 22, 1997: The designation as a freight station was revoked.

sen.j: 舞鶴港に面する日本板硝子舞鶴工場へ6kmほどの専用鉄道が続き、有蓋車による貨物輸送を行っていた。
sen.e: Freight transport service was carried out using boxcars, on the private siding of about 6km toward the Nippon Sheet Glass Co., Ltd. Maizuru Plant facing Maizuru Port.
sen.cmt: 日本板硝子舞鶴工場→Nippon Sheet Glass Co., Ltd. Maizuru Plant[http://www.nsggroup.net/index.html]
sen.e: Freight transport service was carried out using boxcars, on the private siding approximately 6 km toward the Maizuru plant of Nippon Sheet Glass Co., Ltd., facing Maizuru Port.
Freight transport service was carried out using boxcars, on the private siding approximately 6 km toward the Maizuru plant of Nippon Sheet Glass Co., Ltd., facing Maizuru Port.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）4月1日 - JR貨物の駅（貨物の取扱）が廃止される。
sen.e: April 1, 1999: Station of JR-F (for freight service) became disused
April 1, 1999: The station of JR-F (for freight service) became disused.
April 1, 1999: The station of JR-F (for freight service) became disused.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
